nodes.bodyText: Could it use Interface instead: ZKHelixDataAccessor -> HelixDataAccessor?
I cannot remember the details. But there are some places use the method only for ZKHelixDataAccessor but not interface.
Nit: since parameter is boolean type, Boolean.valueOf -> Boolean.parseBoolean()?
parseBoolean can cause exception if that does not match. But the valueOf has a default value.
Add a JavaDoc for a public method. Here, we should explain what skipZkRead parameter does, and its implications.

I suggest we use something like onlyUseZkAsSource or something as the boolean flag, and use the same name all throughout since having skipZkRead and requireFullRead here and there could be confusing down the road.

I understand your concern. But it will be confusing to use one flag because they are completely in different purpose:

Skip the zk access for reading partition health.
Because of the contract we made for customized API, if no entry as body for "PARTITION", they will return all the partition health status. If they have it but partition list is empty, no result will be return. Here' when we only do partition health retrieving, we dont know what are the partitions on the instance. Also this function I would say is a separate function and logically not connected with "skipZKRead"

I can add some comments in the function and rename the function. But I do not think make this name to be "onlyUseZkAsSource" is a good choice. There are no logic related to ZK for this private function.
Suggest we consolidate the nomenclature for the boolean flag (as explained above).

Final requires constructor have redundant code. Tried to refactor, but there is no good solution. Otherwise, the new constructor need to do same assignment for each fields once.
And there is no set during the process. I think it should be fine.
Could we remove this constructor since you added a more comprehensive one below?
Why does this jsonContent need multiple string concatenations?
Was for viewing purpose for each entry set a line. Let me format it.
Why we cannot combine this case together with the case where skipZKRead is set to true? Is that because backward compatibility make it harder to code?

Because there are a couple of scenarios:

Partitions read from ZK, they are all healthy. No expired partitions. Directly return the ZK partition data.
Partitions read from ZK, there are some expired partitions, query SN to get latest update.
Partitions skip read from ZK, no partition data from ZK and no expired data, query SN without any partition specific to get all partition health status.
